comment: She cares. Like actually cares. She'll answer every question and will go out of her way to help you understand the material. Go to class to get the gist from her and then review with Prof. Leonard on YouTube to lock it down. Take her if you can. She's cheerful, welcoming, and goes the extra mile for her students.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Very nice professor, she cares, I wish I locked in because I was so close to getting an A. Lots of Aleks hw due throughout the week, and the occasional groupwork/ pop quiz. Tests aren't hard but there are few questions so getting a question wrong is more points lost. Not sure if attendance was mandatory but she took it anyways.

I loved her so much!!!!!! She was so sweet and so kind!!! Attendance is mandatory, pop quizzes 1-2x a week, and random classwork. However I missed A LOT of class and still got an A+. Easy to get a 100% on every exam if you just do the study guide. She was an amazing professor and I will miss her!!

Professor Joseph is truly one of the best professors at ksu. She is one of the sweetest people ever and that shows in the way she teaches. She keeps the class engaged. There are pop quizzes but they are fairly easy and she grades them super nicely. The tests are not hard if you study. She also gives extra credit. I was never afraid to ask questions

So sweet and cares a lot about what she teaches. Does give a lot of homework, 2-3 assignments a week on ALEKS. The class moves very fast, so attendance is required to understand any of it. She also doesn't have online lectures or material for the units, so you have to be in class to learn it.

waste of 3 hours a week. Prerequisite quizzes required for each topic (You teach yourself and take a quiz on it before she teaches you, making her job pointless)attendance is mandatory even though you already know the info. Random pop quizzes, large portion & test grading: even if the answer is correct you must show work or you receive half credit.

If math is your thing then sure take her but if you are average like me then I wouldn't recommend she doesn't really help you understand the material being given and she goes through it way too fast. If you look for outside help like si sessions & the smart center you could pass. Just make sure to show up to class bc of the pop quizzes. 6/10
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: By all means avoid this professor. If you're not good at math choose someone else because you could literally try your all and still fail the class. she includes extra credit in the test but that barely helps. She made the class and the test harder than what they needed to be. DO NOT TAKE HER!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Professor Joseph doesn't allow students to retake tests if they were absent and not able to attend. If you have a 69, 79, or 89 just know she will not round your grade no matter what. Professor Lori is also a really strict grader so be prepared. Her class wasn't too bad, but I'm sure there are better professors you can find.

She is a good person but I wouldn't say she is a great teacher. She tries to understand her students but at the end of the day there is only so much she can do. you also do not get a lot of help when it comes to exams which weigh a lot in this course. Not an easy class by any means

Prof. Joseph is amazing! She explains concepts clearly and is always willing to help. Definitely take advantage of her review guides - they're super helpful. And try out Unstuck study for extra prep. Overall, a great class!

Definitely the best professor I've had so far. She cares about her students and makes class engaging. It is aleks based which is the only downside and she does pop quizzes but she grades them and the tests leniently. I'd recommend taking her for pre calc.

Best precalc professor by far! Genuinely cares about her students and wants everyone to do well. Gives a lot of extra credit and is always open to answering any questions. Heavily rounds test grades if the class doesn't do well and needs extra help. Loved her lectures. Very sweet and makes precalc manageable. TAKE HER
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She's a very nice professor, but never tells us when we have graded assignments or quizzes, only tests. Students get to write notecards that we can use during tests, and she wont let you make up a missed quiz if you werent able to make it to class. Lots of quizzes and class assignments, gives A LOT of homework on ALEKS.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Prof. Joseph is very loving, caring, and respectful. She explained amazingly, but the only thing I didn't like was her speed, she teaches so quickly. I could have gotten an easy A if I didn't miss her classes. Pro tip: Even if you miss her classes, make sure you keep track of desmos. And beware of pop quizzes.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I loved having her as a professor. I will 100% be taking her again for any other math classes I need. There is a lot of ALEKS homework, but it is very helpful and should be taken seriously. ATTEND CLASS. There will be pop quizzes and Desmos assignments that have to be completed for credit. She is also super nice, which is very refreshing.

She was very friendly and I was never scared to ask questions even if they were seemingly low-level. She explains things very clearly and in a way that is intuitive for the person learning. Her quizzes are also very low-stakes because we got to work with partners + she gives a lot of partial credit. 

I wish I could take her again for calc :(

I took her twice. Show up to class and you should be fine. Attendance is not part of your grade, however there are daily activities and pop quizzes where participation is essentially all that you're graded on. 2 quizzes and 2 daily activities dropped at the end of the semester. Curves tests, very accessible and kind. Take her!!

I wish she was my teacher for every class. The content may be difficult at times, but she will teach you how to do something four different ways until you understand it. Very forgiving grader, especially on her pop quizzes. Study guides are the same as the test but she chooses the easier questions every time. Can't recommend enough!

If math is your kyrptonite then this is the class for you. Dr. Joseph does a pretty good job at explaining the material and is a joy be around. The Weekly homework is on ALEKS which can be a pain if you don't keep up with it and she does give out pop quizzes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment:
This class uses ALEKS. It sucks but most math classes at KSU do. She was a nice lady, and also a math nerd. We had a lot of pop-up assignments in class so for the love of all that is holy--come to class!!

I don't have anything bad to say about this professor. You'll survive even if you're mid at math. Just be prepared for the horror that is Aleks.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: It is kinda my fault I did not obtain a B or higher in the class. Homework weekly along with occasional pop quizzes. Reviews are similar to tests. She is a very kind person and wants to see u succeed!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Joseph was a GREAT teacher! She truly cares about all her students and wants them to pass. Make sure you talk in class; she doesn't mind going back and finding new ways to explain things. There was a lot of Alek homework, but if you complete it, you'll be ready for the tests.

Personally liked professor Joseph but teaching and going over content, I became confused... which led me to withdraw for my sake and my GPA- if you're good at math go ahead but if you're ehhh I wouldn't take her. I will say she provides different math outlets on campus to get better at content.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Made my algebra class harder than it had to be. She gave so many pop quizzes so if you don't go to class you won't pass. She was super sweet and graded pretty easily but she did not explain how to do the problems very well. I felt like I constantly had to do extra work and teach myself just to keep up.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Best math teacher I have ever had. There is quite a bit of homework but it is super helpful for the tests. Do the test reviews and take notes in class and you should do great.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: She is super nice. She treats students like her children and she so sweet. She wants students to succeed. She even tries super hard to bump up grades or slips easy pop quizzes to help your grade. Mrs Joseph is great for someone who is not the best at math. You practice so much where you understand everything by the time you get to the test.

Professor Joseph is one of the best professors and is one who cares about her students so much. She is very sweet and makes sure everyone understands what she is teaching. I didn't do so well in the class but this is my fault for just being bad at math. Definitely take this class.

The best math teacher I have ever had. She respects her students and tries to help everyone to the best of her abilities. I feel really prepared for calculus after taking her class. If you struggle with math I absolutely recommend taking her.

Lori Joseph is like a mother. She is very caring and very nice. She cares for her students and it shows in her teaching/grading. If you're having trouble, just ask for help, she is more than willing to meet you on your level and help clear things up. She's the nicest professor I have ever had. She also doesnt load you with Aleks work which is nice.
Professor Joseph is very laid-back and genuinely wants to see you succeed. She does give occasional pop quizzes, but overall the workload is not bad at all.

Prof. Joseph is probably one of the best precalc teachers, so take her if you can! The way she teaches makes math easy to learn. She hands out worksheets so you don't have to struggle to do your own notes. There were only 3 exams plus the final, but I did well on all of them because she curves or will take out questions no one understood.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: She teaches step by step and makes it easy

Professor Joseph is one of the best math teachers i've had in a LONG time. She is funny and extremely caring. The way she explains algebra is simple to follow along, and as long as you show your work, you can get credit. Her college algebra class was fun and engaging, I actually attended her classes because I wanted to LEARN.
She is a wonderful professor who really cares for her students. I am bad at math but she made precal not as bad. Take her if you can!! She also gives out candy

Professor Joseph was an amazing professor! She is available to help outside of class a bunch. Her tests are very difficult, she offers extra credit on them. You are allowed a notecard for tests but make sure you study!! Class is very fast paced and her teaching style is kind of tricky. Attendance is key... pop quizzes happen frequently so show up!

I've failed math countless times in high school but Prof Joseph made math sm better for me. Best advice: if you are struggling REACH OUT! Amazing at answering questions/making sure u are okay with the material. The Math Open Lab is an amazing resource for tutoring she works at! Extra credit on tests. Pop quizzes usually in groups. Very caring :)

I would not recommend this class to anybody who is bad at math . Take someone else . Lori is a very sweet lady , but she  teaches  way to fast for me . Although she provides flash cards for test . BUT the test are VERY VERY HARD . nothing like the study guide . Only take her class if its your last hope . Goodluck

Lori Joseph is a very understanding professor. I had some health concerns and she granted me a last minute opportunity to still receive credit. She truly wants her students to do well and is willing to help you. She frequently gives out extra credit opportunities and attending class is a must. You will not pass if you skip.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Lori Joseph was my favorite professor i have ever had. She makes sure all students are on track. Very accessible outside of class. Attendance is mandatory due to graded assignments in class. Aleks homework every week. Most likely will let you have a cheat sheet note card for tests.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: She acts like she was never in school. If your at a 69 or 79 you will stay there. She will not bump anything. No matter your situation. Does her job but doesnt care for her students success

Lori Joseph is an incredible teacher. She made math fun and that is really impressive. Her teaching style is very hands on and she gives a lot of in class practice. Tests had no surprises and the questions were not unfamiliar. Very caring and supportive, reach out if you're struggling and she will help. Brought candy on test days. My favorite prof

Joesph is an amazing teacher & cares about her students greatly. She let us have note cards on almost all of our tests. This is a hard class with any professor but she made it manageable. Show up for class for in-class assignments,do the homework/ test reviews. She will literally answer emails in the middle of the night if you need her! TAKE HER
She’s the GOAT. If you’re a freshman take her class. She’s literally the best. You won’t regret it.

Professor Joseph was an amazing teacher. She worked hard to make sure all of her kids knew the information. As long as you do the homework and listen in class she gives you everything you need to succeed. Math is my worst subject, but i really enjoyed it with her. She helps you when ever you ask and gives plenty of extra credit.

She's very nice but she is just way too smart and makes the intro level class for math just too difficult. Unless you're really good at math, you'll have a really hard time in here. So many problems were so confusing and the way she explained them was even more confusing. Tests are very hard and I failed all of them. Do not recommend.
Hard class which is really her fault but she is nice. My only gripe with her is when I didnt understand something she wasnt very good at finding other ways to get me to understand.

Tons of weekly homework on ALEKS. Semi frequent in class assignments that you need to be in class to access although attendance isnt technically mandatory. Not really the style of teaching that I prefer for math. Explains very basic topics in class, hw is harder, tests are farrr harder. Good professor but be prepared to study.

Not gonna lie, MATH1113 is difficult as it is but Prof. Joseph makes it just a little bit easier. She's super nice & very understanding. If you do take her & begin struggling, go immediately to her office hours b/c those are so much more helpful!! Get ready to spend 8hrs+ on ALEKS HW b/c those HW are no joke & will get you frustrated rq (Fall 2021)

She is a great teacher and cares a lot about her students. Walks around the class to make sure everyone understands. If you skip class you will miss out on stuff that will be on the tests. 4 tests including the final and homework on Aleks. If you struggle in math I would take her but you have to be able to speak up and ask for help if you need it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She is a sweet lady and cares about her students. The class is very hard if you are not math inclined. I went to every lecture and studied for hours but only passed one test. Class uses Aleks, and there's 4 tests including the final. Study guides didn't help me on the tests. She is just too smart for the class. I struggled the whole semester.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She is absolutely amazing! Precalc is a harder class, but if you do the homework and go to class you will be fine! She genuinely cares about you and your grade in the class. I would definitely be taking her classes again!

Loved this professor! Consists of 4 take-at-home tests (which would let us use the notes we had), a total of 8 quizzes, each being 5 questions (lockdown browser+ cam); which wasn't hard at all because she would provide a study guide beforehand. Each week we had homework due which would be done through ALEKS (can be tricky) ATTEND SI SESSIONS!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: A really sweet and caring professor. Homework and tests are on ALEKS and tests are lockdown but she provides review guides that really help. Even with how annoying ALEKS can be, she is always willing to work with you and help you succeed. Always checking in on students too when they are working on problems. Make sure you take good notes.
Works well with you if you need help. Makes it easy to understand concepts. Overall great professor

Professor Joseph is my favorite math teacher I have ever had! She is really good at explaining things and is very approachable which makes it easy for you to ask questions. The material was a bit tough, but if you pay attention during class and study a little bit you will be fine! There is weekly homework, but it only takes about 1-2 hours to do.

I have mixed feelings about this teacher. Many of the kids in my class did not like her but I actually found her enjoyable. She provides handouts to help you understand the material and we use ALEKS for this class. She seems to wander off-topic a bit but other than that I passed still. She drops the two lowest ALEKS score and other stuff.

She is too smart for the students good. Her class itself is easy but when it comes to the tests she makes them too difficult, because she makes them based off what is easy for her to do. You have a lot of homework and then the tests are the only other grade.

This woman is one of the nicest professors I have ever had! Truly cares for her students, answers emails quick, and does everything in her power to help you understand as long as you ask. You learn to love the corky humor.

Prof. Joseph is the best! Super sweet and caring and she will make 100% sure that you understand all of the content in this course. She is VERY understanding and responsive to any and all concerns one may have. Understanding math is easy with professor Joseph. This is the first time I've enjoyed going to math in a long time!
Horrible to say the least. Attendance quizzes and very difficult tests. Save yourself and do not take her, ever.

Professor Joseph is one of the best math teachers ever. I took her College Algebra class as a freshman, and was blown away at how well she taught the course. I struggled with math in high school, but thanks to Prof. Joseph, I feel ready to pursue a career in the mathematical world. She is also one of the kindest people you will ever meet!!

She was very nice and sweet to her students, while this class was easy for me considering i was quick to pick up on the basics of algebra for students who struggle with math will not have a great time. Her lectures are all around lack luster and don't really help you remember much for what's to come on the test. Also know that ALKES is no joke!!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: A great first college math teacher - literally gave us candy before tests. Made topics very easy to learn and was always available after class to answer questions. Made study guides that were identical to tests. The only downside was that she assigned TONS of online tests/HW that were hard to complete or makeup, which tanked my grade. LOVE HER THO!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Tests don't reflect the lectures or homework at times and sometimes those lectures may have you lost in mathematical jargon. The most lethal part about the class is the ALEK HW system, especially since it's a big part of your grade. It forces prerequisite topics that prevent you from doing the required HW assignment. Tutoring hardly helps too.
Explains the material very well, always willing to help, super nice!

I love Mrs. Joseph! She will take as long as she needs to make sure you understand things, and she brings candy to every test day to make students happy! The homework is reasonable, and as long as you go to class and ask questions, you shouldn't have a problem doing well!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Joseph is like a caring mom. She genuinely wants you to do well. She uses an online program for homework that you have each week. If you pay attention in class and do the homework, you will do well. She also gives a lot of extra credit throughout the class and drops a lot of your lowest grades at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Coming to class is important to understand the material. Not many quizzes but she always lets you get help from a neighbor. Tests are just like the review she gives you. She likes to get to know her students and she always answers questions.
Mrs. Joseph is an awesome math teacher. She is always very willing to help and answer questions. She is also very kind and relatable. Math was very easy to understand with her!

Mrs. Lori is an overall good teacher. She has open office times before class. Test are 60% of your grade so study (even though she drops the lowest grade). Come to class and she'll respect you more and help you. One on one sessions are a good idea, she can work based on how you learn, especially since how she teaches is sometimes hard to understand
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: She is a very sweet lady. And her class was overall easy for me but i took pre calc in high school. Without it i wouldve made a B or C. Her study guides are exactly like the test, she just changes her numbers. She does teach quickly though, but allows for time to review.

Professor Lori is such a sweetheart and cares so much for her students but is a horrible teacher. She teaches by working the problems out for herself and we just copy notes. Everytime I asked her for help 95% of the time she couldn't explain because she didn't know how. I would've passed with an A but she legit couldnt teach, Very nice lady though.

Spends the class talking to students who already get it. Tests dont match reviews. In mymathlab had an A in homework (after teaching myself) did well on in class assignments/quizzes but still got a D in the class because I didnt do well on the tests which are the bulk of your grade. Tip: Memorize the unit circle and get a tutor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: She basically runs through a concept quickly and hands you a paper expecting you to know what to do every class. Tests will look slightly different from study guides. Things are not explained clearly and there is a lot of Mymathlab homework. Class is for advanced math people only. If math is hard for you, you may fail her class.

Professor Joseph seems nice but she isn't a good teacher. If you struggle with math you will have a hard time. Test reviews are misleading and she is a very harsh grader. On top of that, there is a lot of homework in her class and she will ignore you the more you fall behind. If you struggle with math this teacher will set you up for failure.

Tests are very hard and completely different to the study guide she would give us A DAY before the test. Lectures are more like a VERY fast-paced review, and doesn't care to make sure we understand. Encourages us to email for help but does not help at all. Hwk is A LOT. Taught myself everything. Worth math class ever.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: If youre not good at math, shes probably not the best professor for you. She moves at an accelerated pace without actually explaining any of the topics. Prof. joseph also gives A LOT of pop quizzes, at least every other day so show up to class. She does use math lab and assigns a lot of HW. Come to office hours and shes a lot more help
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Don't take this woman if your not good at math. Her exams are 60% of your grade and is a very harsh grader. That does not know how to teach things anything but the way that she understands it. Beware take at own risk. Oyubhave to teach yourself everything. Also give out a study guide one class period before the exam. That makes no sense.

The absolute WORST professor I've ever had. Don't get me wrong, she is a very nice lady and is pretty interesting, but if you are not amazing at math, do NOT take her. Every single class felt like a review rather than her actually teaching. You will basically have to teach yourself the entire unit outside of class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Worst math class I've ever taken. Had to drop the class by the 2nd test, test average for both tests for the class were both under 55%! Get ready to teach yourself everything. Don't get me wrong she's a really sweet lady but awful teacher. Whispers halfway into her sentences, doesn't go over tests, accelerated pace without making sure we KNOW it..
A very sweet woman, she can tend to ramble some but knows what shes talking about. I struggle in math and did well

Prof. Joseph is one of the kindest and most easy-going educators I have ever met. If you show her that you care about your own success, she will do everything she can to help you reach your goals. She makes pre-calculus very easy to understand and responds well to questions. You won't regret taking her for MATH1113!!

Professor Joseph is the best math teacher I have ever had! I came into Pre-Calculus having had no trigonometry, and she helped me every step of the way. She is so encouraging and treats each student like her own. You have to do your part, but she is more than willing to help you. Would HIGHLY recommend!

Her class was really enjoyable! We had four tests, a final, and multiple in class assignments. Homework is due the day of the test, and she gives plenty of time to finish it and to ask her questions. She really cares about her students and is willing to help at all times!

Great proffesor genuinely cares about the succes of her students, super nice and likes to have fun with her class. She does alot of group quizes which for me personally i like alot. Her test are similar to the study guide. She does use mymathlab which to be is the devil but its what ever. All and all one of the best proffesors i have had.

Good teacher. She cares a lot about her students and does her best to help out where she can. Some of the work is a little challenging. I had to do some self teaching but it wasn't terrible. Class is her working examples and then giving you a worksheet for practice. There are pop quizzes but they're group quizzes.

She is so incredibly kind and caring. She takes attendance, but she cares is your not in class and checks in to make sure you are ok. She gives pop quizzes, but they are usually group quizzes and pretty simple if you understand the math. Its simple to get an A if you did well in Precalc in high school. The way she teaches makes math seem simple.
Very nice lady, I had her for pre-calculus. Overall the material was a bit challenging but she gives you all the resources you need to succeed.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She's a really sweet lady but you should really pay attention in class so that you don't bomb the quizzes. Her tests are straightforward and she gives reviews before every test. All of her notes are online. Attendance is mandatory but it's not that boring of a class so you should definitely go.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: Best math teacher EVER. I usually suck at math, but she makes it so much easier to understand. She cares so much about her students and really goes out of her way to help you through anything. Highly reccomend her. Amazing 100%
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: The class itself is kind of tough but she loves her students. SHe tries her best to not only help you but help you pass the class. DO your math lab. SHe drops 2 lowest test grades and quizzes. She will also throw in bonuses. Class is not mandatory but if you dont go you wont pass

Prof. Joseph is the best! Although the class was hard, she helps you every step of the way. She does give lots of homework- too much. There are many pop quizzes, but it is often a group quiz. Take her if you can!
rating_tags: Respected--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Great teacher. She is nice and explains things really slowly and clearly. The homework helps prepare you for the test and test reviews are exactly like the test. She drops the lowest quiz and test. Wish I could take her for every math class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She tends to go really fast during lectures, which confuses me. You can tell she truly cares about her students though. I think I struggled because her office hours were during my other classes so I could never go to her for help. Her study guides are just like the tests (fill in the blank). Expect pop quizzes like at least every other class!!!

Professor Joseph is an awesome teacher. I hate math but I attended every class and got an A. She drops the lowest test and quiz grades. The quizzes are pop quizzes, though she usually warns you the class before. If you go to class and try, you will pass! Shes really sweet and wants everyone to succeed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: Professor Garefino is super nice but when she teaches something, she teaches multiple ways to do one problem. It gets confusing and I had a hard time following. She had like 5 tests and a final. drops lowest test and quiz grade. Also randomly does pop quizzes. Tons of online homework.
rating_tags: Respected--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Joseph is far from interesting, but the class is fairly easy if you can just pay attention. She drops your lowest test and quiz grade.

Professor Joseph was one of the best math teaches that I've ever had. She really takes the time to thoroughly explain every topic, and she really makes sure that you're set up to succeed. She does give pop quizzes, but if you pay attention in class they aren't hard. Plus, on tests and the final, she always walks around to give help if you need it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I loved Lori. She genuinely wants every student to do well and be happy. She drops the two lowest quiz grades and lowest test grade. There's a project worth 50 points that's super easy. The material in the class isn't too hard, but Lori will explain it in weird analogies and then do it algebraically. If you try you'll do well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Lori is a sweet woman, but she definitely makes things harder than they need to be. She also gives around 7  unannounced pop quizzes, but she will keep your 6 highest grades.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: Great math teacher. She tends to go a little fast sometimes, but if you don't understand something she will slow down and answer your question and make sure you understand it. Cares deeply for students. Responds to emails FAST. BEWARE OF POP QUIZ EVERY CHAPTER. If you miss it, it's a zero. TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Very good teacher. I am a few years older than most in my class, so I'm struggling a bit. She's extremely helpful, and even stayed an hour late in her office to help me out and even gave me good advice about pursuing music therapy. She genuinely cares about her students.  KSU needs more profs like her. I wish I hadn't waited so long to take her.

I love Professor Joseph!  She's one of the nicest teachers I've ever had.  She is very good at explaining concepts and shows 2-3 different ways to solve things so you can find which works best for you.  Grade is a homework grade from my math lab, tests, a final, and pop quizzes.  Attendance isn't mandatory but go if you want quiz grades!

SHE IS THE NICEST AND MOST CARING PROFESSOR EVER!!! She is always willing to help.  Drops lowest test and quizzes. There's a ton of homework, but if you do it then you will get an A on the test. if you ask a question during a test, she will basically give you the answer. TAKE HER
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Tests are super easy. Take about 5 of them,lowest one dropped. 6-8 quizzes with 1 or 2 dropped. One project that was super easy, 100 percent easily. Lots of homework in My Math Lab but you can get 100 on almost all of them which is 10 of your grade. If you ask her a question during at test or quiz she will help you A LOT in finding the answer.

I absolutely love Professor Joseph. She is so nice and always willing to help. She makes algebra really easy. There are only 2 projects (super easy- will take you 45min tops). She will offer extra credit sometimes, all you have to do is ask. I wish i could take her for all my math courses.

Joseph's a great person & is always willing to lend a hand for a student falling behind in class. To pass you must take notes, ask questions, & do all the homework on MML. The class can get difficult at times, especially if you haven't had Algebra in a few years, but as long as you do all the HW & study you should be fine. Tons of HW on MML.

Mrs. Joseph is the best professor I've had in college. She is very kind &willing to help students! Once, when I was having a bad day, she noticed and emailed after class to check up on me. She gives pop quizzes but will drop the lowest 2.  To get a good grade, take notes in class, ask questions, do the mml hmwk, and do the practice tests!

I loved her so much, very kind & friendly. Puts study guides online, use them, really similar to the tests. She gives pops quizzes but drops the lowest one. Did one extra credit pop quiz. Come to class because if you miss a pop quiz it will begin to affect your grade (you can sort of figure out the days you will have one). Would def take her again!
LOVED Professor Joseph. Super sweet and goes above and beyond to make sure her students understand.
Professor Joseph was the best teacher i have had in college so far. She offers office hours and if you go and put in the effort she will help you. She really wants you to su red and is so kind.

Mrs. Joseph was an amazing professor. She's really nice, and she will help you if you need it. There are a lot of quizzes, but she drops at least 1 depending on the number of quizzes given. She also drops the lowest test grade. She also brings candy on test days.

I love Professor Joseph!! Brings candy on test days and there are MANY test days. Multiple pop quizzes throughout the semester, but attendance isn't nessecary, but you need to go to class in order to pass. Offers extra credit and projects for grade boosters.  Mymathlab homework assignments were a pain, but great class for the most part!

Mrs. Joseph is probably the nicest professor at KSU. At least for me her lectures were easy, but she assigned pop quizzes and a lot of homework on MyMathLab. You get to drop your lowest 2 quizzes and 1 test. She also has 2 easy projects. Would definitely recommend!

Prof Joseph is such caring and kind person. She truly cars about you and your future. TAKE HER!! She is the best math professor as well as caring person you will ever have. Love her. Wish she taught more.

Professor Joseph is without a doubt one of the best math teachers I have had. She is a bright and positive person, and she cares for her students. I highly recommend taking her. She also drops your lowest test grade and takes the top 5 grades for pop quizzes (which are pretty predictable).

She is awesome. she gives homework but it is all due the day before the test so you have plenty of time to do it. If you ever need help, all you have to do is email her and she will help you with anything. She is really funny and nice and it seems like she really cares for her students. If I had the choice, I would definitely take her again.

Professor Joseph is the sweetest teacher I have ever had and she really cares for her students.  If you're really horrible at math she's an awesome teacher and describes everything really well. If you're good at math her lectures are sometimes boring.  Her tests are straight from her review and I highly recommend her as a teacher!!

Professor Joseph is amazing! The class can drag on sometimes simply because it's math, but she is a very understanding teacher. I would most DEFINITELY recommend this lady. She is so sweet and you can tell she truly cares for her students.

Sweetest lady ever! Great teacher, will go to the ends of the earth to help you, really easy class. Some homework and occasional pop quizzes, but overall, I would definitely take her again! Also, she brings Jolly Ranchers and Starburst to class on test days.
She likes to get off topic a lot. She is overall a great teacher. If you email her she responds almost immediately. She will do anything she can to help you. Definitely would take again.
She is by far one of the best professors I've had at KSU. She really wants her students to understand and tries to help in any way that she can. Gives partial points on test and quizzes.

Nicest lady ever! If you need help you can always show up at her office before her first class & help for as long as she can. Wants you to get a good grade! gives examples multiple ways so all students get to understand! does a fun easy A Initials project! Homework is unlimited try so its a easy 100! Final is 30% of grade and cumulative.

AMAZING. She's the nicest lady I've ever met. Brings jolly ranchers every test day.  Go to class, pay attention, do hw and test reviews and her class is a breeze. Drops lowest 2 quizzes and test. Final is simple. Loved this class!
She is awesome! Go to class and do your homework. Her study guides are just like the tests. She drops your lowest test grade at the end of the semester. Take her! She is great!

Sweet, sweet lady. She is very kind  and wants what is best for her students. Professor Joseph knows the material well and can teach the class very well. There's quite a bit of homework, but none of it is too terribly hard and she will help you with it. Her tests aren't terrible but, they could be easier, and again, ask and she'll help.

Mrs. Joseph is a great teacher and very friendly and helpful. I like that she doesn't make attendance mandatory, but if you constantly skip class, you probably won't survive the class. Overall, I would recommend her.

Professor Joseph is an awesome professor ! Coveys information clearly and she is very helpful and genuinely cares for her students. She will work with you through any difficulty. Homework is assigned every night.
Easy, easy, easy. attendance isn't mandatory. drops 2 lowest quizzes and lowest test. easy hw on my math lab.

Professor Joseph is awesome! She is extremely helpful and posts all class notes online for your reference. Attendance is not mandatory but highly recommended due to unannounced quizzes and extra credit points. Don't be shy about asking questions on tests- she literally walks you through the problem!

She is the sweetest person, awesome teacher, homework is a gauranteed 100 (mymathlab) and she will literally help you solve problems on tests. Genuinely cares about her students AND is a great teacher. Go to class cause she gives pop quizzes all the time but drops at least 2. Best teacher I have every had at KSU!!!!!! TAKE HER

Professor Joseph is an awesome teacher! Attendance not mandatory, but unless you want to teach yourself, make sure you show up. She also gives quizzes without notice. MyMathLab is tedious and time-consuming, but if you work at it every day it's not impossible. If you are driven enough, an A is easy. Take her!

She's a super nice teacher. I hate math and I'm bad at it, but she made it so easy and simple to understand. She's super helpful and the tests are straightforward. You don't need the book just go to class

Ms. Joseph is an extremely nice teacher who will give extra help to anyone who needs it outside of class. She moves a bit fast in class but not too fast to understand. I ended up with a C in her class but it was my own fault, I easily could have earned a high B or an A. She uses a LOT of MyMathlab homework which isn't hard at all and helps a lot.

She is an great teacher, very easy. Very helpful. Out of all of my professors she is the only one i'm writing a rate on, because she deserves it. She is very sweet, brings the class jolly ranchers for test days! She is very helpful when taking tests or quizzes if she can elaborate for you. PLEASE TAKE HER!

I absolutely love Professor Joseph. She's super helpful and makes everything easy to understand. She makes all the tests herself and gives extra credit. the "pop" quizzes are easy and meant to boost your grade a bit and the workload isn't very heavy. I would definitely recommend her. Anyone should make at LEAST a high B in this class. take her!

Professor Joseph was awesome! She's a really sweet lady who will work with you to make sure you get the grade you want (you do have to work at it though.) I would definitely take her for 1107 but unfortunately she will only be teaching 1111. If you get the opportunity, you should definitely take her class!
